instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message:
Morning guys.
Logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B. no image. screen illuminates. no chime ( may be turned off). Logic board is immaculate.... to immaculate TBH.
Tested so far:-
Pins 18/19 J8300 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD_UF</SIGNAL> =0.00v
L8304 Pins 1/2 =0.00v
<RESISTOR>R5670</RESISTOR> not fitted
<CHIP>U8300</CHIP> pin 1 <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>= 0.00v
           pin 2/3 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> =3.334v
           pin 4/5 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD_R</SIGNAL> =0.001v
           pin 6 GND =OK
J8300 pin 14 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> =0.00v
           pin 24 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><0> =0.001v
           pin 24 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><0> =0.00v

Seeing as the screen is illuminating I have not tested pins 3/4 on J8300

Now, I am assuming that <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> needs to be present to activate <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> but reading the shematic ( probably incorrectly) this leads back to pin 765 on the CPU. using Landrex I do not see anywhere that I can test for <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>. Also.... might be me and it being an early morning, I have done a search on the forum for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image even down to a straight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> search and apart for a post that has Duke on it where it is surmized that the CPU is dead, I have found nothing with reference to this issue on this board.

Has anyone got any pointers or is it in fact a "gonna"?

Many thanks in advance.

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message:
"J8300 pin 14 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> =0.00v"
High level means LCD panel correctly recognized.
LCD needs to get voltage at pins 18/19 of J8300 in the first few seconds at least, in order to put high <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> signal.
Strange to have backlight in your case...

Check first if has USB activity; using OSX pendrive with link LED is the best option.
You can also try PRAM reset, see if chime comes too.

I recommend to test known good (compatible) LCD assembly.

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message:
Hi [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] . OK above testing was done without the screen attached. I did do a PRAM and SMC reset prior to doing the probing, but did the PRAM one again. I also reconnected the screen.
Updated info:-
Still no chine.
Connected a HDD that I have got multiple OSx on and the LED flashes. I also plugged in a keyboard and used to do the PRAM and SMC reset. As to the PRAM the logic board restarted and the SMC the LED on the adapter changed from orange to green and back to orange so I can clarify the USB side of things are working.
Pins 18/19 of J8300 with screen connected goes to 3.331v and stays at that voltage.
Pin 14 goes to 2.63v and stays.

I have an MBA here that is a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Is the screen usable with that of the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>? Just for diagnosis puroses.
Thanks.

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message:
3435 uses display port.
Check schematic of your <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board and compare LCD connectors.
This will not assure 100% compatibility however.

"Pin 14 goes to 2.63v and stays."
You had 0V before...
Do you get image now, even no backlight?

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message: HI [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] . Hope you dont mind but i have sent you a PM.

threads.title: Help please <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no image
threads.message: Hi all. After listing the above results and following what [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] suggested, I can comfirm the issue has be diagnosed and awaiting customer confirmation for repair. The issue is the screen unit. Thank you [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] for your assistance. I have sent you an email but I will be posting up the issue with the MBP in another post.
